title: Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: 8 pieces of chicken (or one whole chicken cut into 8 pieces)
1 pound shiitake mushrooms, cleaned, stemmed and sliced
2 cups chopped fresh tomatoes, peeled and seeded
½ pound cooked fettuccine or spaghetti (cooked, tossed in olive oil, salt and pepper)
1 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley leaves
instructions: Season the chicken with Essence Creole seasoning.  Season the flour with the same Essence and in it dredge the chicken, coating it completely.  Shake off the excess.  In a large Dutch oven, over medium-high heat, add the oil.  When the oil is hot, add the chicken and brown the pieces for 3 to 4 minutes on each side.  Remove the chicken and set it aside.

Add the onions, season them with salt and red pepper as they sauté.  Sauté for 2 minutes then add the mushrooms and garlic.  Again season with salt and red pepper and continue sautéing for another 2 minutes.  Stir in the wine, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and the stock.  Now bring the mixture to a boil.  When its boiling stir in the bay leaf, thyme and basil.  Then return the chicken back to the mixture.  Reduce the heat to medium and cover.  Simmer for 1 hour or until tender.
Remarks:  Serve by mounding the pasta in the middle of a plate.  Lay the chicken over the pasta and then spoon the sauce over the chicken.  Garnish with the cheese and parsley.
Source:  Recipe courtesy of Emeril Lagasse, 2000.
